column4: Under gutsy I could run two monitors independently. Under intrepid I cannot. How do I get that behaviour back? I've googled for days and still have no solution. It looks like Gnome is "helping" to manage the monitors because xorg sees them as separate screens.
go to system --> preferences --> screen resolution
click on your screen it should show both screens then
did you click detect screens
and then click apply
Yes
then log out and back in
I had the same problem yesterday
On an Intel graphic card?
Yes I have a toshiba laptop that I use with dual screen
with a intel chip
What did the "Detect Screens" do for you, there was no feedback.
does it show to seperate screens?
Yes.
and you want them to be the same desktop on both so you can drag apps to the other desktop?
No, that's what I have, I *hate* it.
you also need to set the resolution for the different screens
My productivity has gone through the floor. I went from 16 desktops to 8.
so you want them to be the same like a desktop on each
so the menu bars are on both?
No, there are three options. 1. Mirror, two identical screens. 2. One large desktop, what I have. 3. Two different separate screens. What I had and want back.
oh ok I see what you mean
sorry misunderstood
No, that's OK, the issue is that every card manufacturer calls it something different, most people wouldn't want two screens.
